intro: Matelea hispida, commonly known as the rough matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Matelea hispida is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
